alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:12PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry and north central Hooker Counties through 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/... At 1012 PM CDT/912 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Merritt Reservoir to 12 miles northeast of Whitman. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Marsh Flat, Giant Hill, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Sevenmile Hill, Hecla and Kelso. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 172 and 189. Highway 97 between mile markers 65 and 114. Highway 83 between mile markers 181 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for north central Nebraska.
